perturbation.original_text:
20. LAW.

This Agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without reference to the conflicts of laws principles thereunder.
perturbation.changed_text:
20. LAW.

This Agreement shall be governed and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without reference to the conflicts of laws principles thereunder. However, in the event of a dispute, the parties may mutually agree to resolve the issue using the laws of England.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence contradicts the original clause, which stipulates that Delaware law governs the contract. Allowing the parties to 'mutually agree' to use English law introduces uncertainty and potential unenforceability, as it deviates from the clearly defined governing law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Choice of Law Principles

perturbation.original_text:
22. DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCEDURES; LIQUIDATION.

22.1. At any time for so long as both T&L and Igene own an interest in the Operating Company, at the request of either Party in a written notice to the other Party's appointees to the Board, the Parties agree to negotiate in good faith to resolve expeditiously any controversies, claims or disputes between the Parties that may arise from time to time under this Agreement or otherwise relating to the Joint Venture (each a "Board Dispute"). If, after a Board Dispute is addressed and recorded in the minutes in two regular
perturbation.changed_text:
22. DISPUTE RESOLUTION PROCEDURES; LIQUIDATION.

22.1. At any time for so long as both T&L and Igene own an interest in the Operating Company, at the request of either Party in a written notice to the other Party's appointees to the Board, the Parties agree to negotiate in good faith to resolve expeditiously any controversies, claims or disputes between the Parties that may arise from time to time under this Agreement or otherwise relating to the Joint Venture (each a "Board Dispute"). If, after a Board Dispute is addressed and recorded in the minutes in two regular, either party may immediately commence litigation.
perturbation.explanation: The modified clause introduces a contradiction by stating parties 'agree to negotiate in good faith' to resolve disputes, but then immediately allows either party to 'immediately commence litigation'. This nullifies the negotiation requirement and potentially undermines efforts toward amicable resolution.

perturbation.original_text:
17. ASSIGNMENT; PLEDGE OF JOINT VENTURE INTEREST.

Except as permitted pursuant to Article 13.1 hereof, neither Party shall assign or transfer this Agreement, or any and all related rights and obligations in the Joint Venture or all rights and all obligations in any related agreements, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent may not be unreasonably withheld or delayed; provided, however, any Party may assign any or all of its interests in this Agreement or the Operating Company to a wholly-owned subsidiary (which shall at all times remain a wholly-owned subsidiary, and such subsidiary may be a partnership, limited liability company, or corporation) or commonly-owned affiliate of Igene or T&L, as the case may be, provided that the ultimate parent company (e.g. Igene or T&L, as the case may be) shall guarantee such subsidiary's or affiliate's performance hereunder. Without the prior written consent of the other Party, neither Igene nor T&L, as the case may be, shall pledge, encumber, or grant a security interest in, any interest (stock, membership or partnership) in the Operating Company. Any permitted assignee shall, prior to the effectiveness of any assignment to such assignee, agree in writing to be bound by, and assume each obligation of the assigning Party under, this Agreement, and each other document and agreement relating to the Joint Venture to which the assignor (or its Party) is a Party, which such written agreement shall be in a form satisfactory to the Party not assigning its interest hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text:
17. ASSIGNMENT; PLEDGE OF JOINT VENTURE INTEREST.

Except as permitted pursuant to Article 13.1 hereof, neither Party shall assign or transfer this Agreement, or any and all related rights and obligations in the Joint Venture or all rights and all obligations in any related agreements, without the prior written consent of the other Party, which consent may not be unreasonably withheld or delayed; provided, however, any Party may assign any or all of its interests in this Agreement or the Operating Company to a wholly-owned subsidiary (which shall at all times remain a wholly-owned subsidiary, and such subsidiary may be a partnership, limited liability company, or corporation) or commonly-owned affiliate of Igene or T&L, as the case may be, provided that the ultimate parent company (e.g. Igene or T&L, as the case may be) shall guarantee such subsidiary's or affiliate's performance hereunder. Without the prior written consent of the other Party, neither Igene nor T&L, as the case may be, shall pledge, encumber, or grant a security interest in, any interest (stock, membership or partnership) in the Operating Company. Any permitted assignee shall, prior to the effectiveness of any assignment to such assignee, agree in writing to be bound by, and assume each obligation of the assigning Party under, this Agreement, and each other document and agreement relating to the Joint Venture to which the assignor (or its Party) is a Party, which such written agreement shall be in a form satisfactory to the Party not assigning its interest hereunder, unless they wish to be exempt from it.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of 'unless they wish to be exempt from it' contradicts the previous statement, which mandates that permitted assignees must agree in writing to be bound by and assume each obligation of the assigning party under the agreement. The added phrase gives them an easy way out, thereby making the clause unenforceable.
